item.title: [PI] Rocktail Help
item.dc:creator: @Varmisher5150 Varmisher5150
item.description:
@Varmisher5150 wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:6, topic:406946”] if (c.fishitem == 307 && !c.getItems().playerHasItem(313)) { c.sendMessage("You need bait to fish here!"); c.fishing = false; } else { if (c.fishitem == 307 && c.getItems().playerHasItem(313)) { c.fishing = true; }[/quote]

Same thing. Still needs Fishing Bait and Not using the Living Minerals i have in the code. Here is what i have.

if (c.fishitem == 307 && !c.getItems().playerHasItem(313)) { c.sendMessage("You need bait to fish here!"); c.fishing = false; } else if (c.fishitem == 307 && !c.getItems().playerHasItem(15263)) { c.fishing = true;

item.title: [PI] Rocktail Help
item.dc:creator: @Varmisher5150 Varmisher5150
item.description:
@Varmisher5150 wrote:

[quote=“escalation, post:2, topic:406946”]put this in…

                    if (c.fishitem == 307 && !c.getItems().playerHasItem(313)) {
                        c.sendMessage("You need bait to fish here!");
                        c.fishing = false;
                } else {
                    if (c.fishitem == 307 && !c.getItems().playerHasItem(***)) {
                        c.sendMessage("You need *** to fish here!");
                        c.fishing = false;

basicly you are changing the codes to the rock tails and your bait…

Try that…[/quote]

src\server\model\players\skills\Fishing.java:58: 'else' without 'if' } else { ^ src\server\model\players\skills\Fishing.java:62: 'else' without 'if' } else { ^ src\server\model\players\skills\Fishing.java:82: illegal start of expression public void Lol() { ^ src\server\model\players\skills\Fishing.java:82: illegal start of expression public void Lol() { ^ src\server\model\players\skills\Fishing.java:82: ';' expected public void Lol() { ^ src\server\model\players\skills\Fishing.java:88: illegal start of expression public int fishtime(int fish, int req) { ^ src\server\model\players\skills\Fishing.java:88: ';' expected public int fishtime(int fish, int req) { ^ src\server\model\players\skills\Fishing.java:88: <identifier> expected public int fishtime(int fish, int req) { ^ src\server\model\players\skills\Fishing.java:88: not a statement public int fishtime(int fish, int req) { ^ src\server\model\players\skills\Fishing.java:88: ';' expected public int fishtime(int fish, int req) { ^ src\server\model\players\skills\Fishing.java:129: reached end of file while pars ing }→ ^ 11 errors Press any key to continue . . .

This is the error i get.

item.title: [PI] Rocktail Help

item.description:
@escalation wrote:

put this in…

                    if (c.fishitem == 307 && !c.getItems().playerHasItem(313)) {
                        c.sendMessage("You need bait to fish here!");
                        c.fishing = false;
                } else {
                    if (c.fishitem == 307 && !c.getItems().playerHasItem(***)) {
                        c.sendMessage("You need *** to fish here!");
                        c.fishing = false;

basicly you are changing the codes to the rock tails and your bait…

Try that…

item.title: [PI] Rocktail Help
item.dc:creator: @Varmisher5150 Varmisher5150
item.description:
@Varmisher5150 wrote:

Ok I want to be able to fish rocktails on my server using Living Minerals as bait. But the Fishing Rod Item ID is already being used up with regular fishing bait.

if (c.fishitem == 307 && !c.getItems().playerHasItem(313)) { c.sendMessage("You need bait to fish here!"); c.fishing = false;

Is there a way to make this work with Rocktails and Living Minerals or do I have to choose another fishing tool for rocktails? Help pls.

Read full topic
